item.title: ARC Raiders is the Best Cheap Game to Gift This Holiday 2025
item.content:encoded:
If you’re shopping around for that perfect gaming gift this holiday season, look no further than ARC Raiders. This electrifying game has taken the world by storm since being released on October 30, and millions of people have invested in it. It’s arguably the best game to hit the market in 2025, and what’s better, it’s much cheaper than most other new games this year.

Before you hit up the Insider Gaming Holiday 2025 hub for the best deals this Christmas, be sure to scroll down and learn about ARC Raiders, why it’s the best cheap game to gift this holiday season.

ARC Raiders is The Perfect Gift This Christmas

ARC Raiders is an intense multiplayer shooter that puts players in a world torn apart by a robotic threat known as ARC. It’s a community-focused game that allows players to connect with others and work collaboratively to avoid the harsh dangers of this post-apocalyptic world.

If you know someone who likes games like Fallout, Escape from Tarkov, Fortnite, Call of Duty, or Battlefield, this is a perfect pick. It won’t break the bank either, as despite being a massive game with hours and hours of potential, it has a very low price point! You can buy ARC Raiders this Christmas for as little as £23.99!

ARC Raiders is available on Xbox, PlayStation, and PC, and to make it as easy as possible to buy a code this holiday 2025, we’ve pulled together the links that get you the best deals instantly on two major platforms:

It doesn’t end there, though, as there’s a special Deluxe Edition that you can lean on to give huge rewards to whoever you’re buying ARC Raiders for. The Deluxe Edition comes with stacks of in-game content, including a massive 2,400 points that players can use to unlock cool new outfits!

That’s all you need to secure the hottest game this holiday season! If you want more convincing, be sure to stop by our full ARC Raiders review.

Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server what you’re most excited to buy this Christmas.

item.title: Team Cherry is Thinking of Making a New Game Instead of Hollow Knight 3
item.content:encoded:
In a new interview, Team Cherry co-founder Ari Gibson sat down with Jason Schreier to discuss the studio’s success and what could be next for Team Cherry, and it might not be Hollow Knight 3.

During the interview (via Bloomberg), Schreier asked Gibson what’s next for Team Cherry after they complete Silksong: Hollow Knight’s DLC content, to which Gibson said that “we do have other games that we plan to make”, citing that their only concern is the time that it now takes to make games.

“The only time concern really is — and we’ve talked about this before — death. It’s not that far off if you spend seven years per project, and potentially add another two. So it’d be nice to do a few more games,” he said.

Schreier immediately jumped on the comment, asking if Team Cherry intends to create more games within the same universe or go somewhere else entirely.

Gibson replied, “We have said we’ll go elsewhere as well. Although we’ve also said those experiences will still be about exploring big worlds full of weird characters and giant bosses and whatnot. So there would be a through line there that people will be familiar with. That’s not to say we won’t return to these Hollow Knight worlds. We do have ideas around what forms those would take. But we also don’t want to be exclusively people that make Hollow Knight.”

Gibson then said that it doesn’t mean he would necessarily be annoyed at making another Silksong, and that he just thinks it will be ” interesting for us to explore the same things we’re interested in but maybe in a slightly different genre, slightly different theme, and how that affects the stories we come up with.”

As for now, though, it seems like Team Cherry doesn’t really have something concretely set up for their next project, and if anything, it’ll probably be another 4-5 years until we find out what they are working on.

What do you think Team Cherry should do next? Would you welcome a Hollow Knight 3? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Best Razer Gaming Tech For Pro Gifts This Holiday 2025
item.content:encoded:
Razer is one of the best gaming brands on the market, bar none. It’s a label that’s synonymous with pro players, and that’s why Razer accessories make for the best gifts this holiday season. If you’re in the market for some incredible Razer deals to stuff stockings with this Christmas, you’ll want to check out what we’ve gathered below.

From the best Razer headset to the newest pro controller on the market, we’ve got the hottest deals you’ll find anywhere. For more, be sure to stop by Insider Gaming’s Holiday 2025 deals hub for the best deals online right now.

The Best Razer Accessories This Holiday 2025

Razer Blackshark V3 Pro

The Razer Blackshark V3 Pro is undoubtedly one of the best gaming headsets for gifting this holiday season. It has a premium price point of $249.99, but the bang you get for your buck with this headset is unparalleled. Your gaming giftee will be able to hear a pin drop across the map and will be able to game for hours in the utmost comfort for hours on end.

Razer Raiju V3 Pro

If you don’t want to break the bank with a Battle Beaver or a Scuf controller, the Razer Raiju V3 Pro is the best controller for aspiring pro gamers this holiday season. It’s a capable, durable, and customizable controller with stacks of technology under the hood. It’ll set you back around $219.99, but that premium price point reflects the quality of this device, which bears that classic Razer branding and name.

Razer Viper V3 Pro

As one of the newest and best esports gaming mice on the market, the Razer Viper V3 Pro is a classic reimagined. It’s the perfect mouse to slip into someone’s stocking this Christmas, as it’s guaranteed to make them a better gamer overnight! The Razer Viper V3 Pro is absolutely our pick for one of the best Razer gaming gifts you could give this holiday 2025.

Let us know what you’ve got your eye on for your festive spending this holiday 2025 over on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Anti-Cheat Has Blocked 2.4 Million Cheat Attempts
item.content:encoded:
In a recent article published by the Electronic Arts teams behind Battlefield 6, it was revealed that a staggering 2.4 million cheat attempts have been blocked by EA’s Javelin anti-cheat system since the game came out on October 10. It was additionally noted that, in the week after launch, 98% of matches were ‘fair and free of cheater impacts.’

This is only just the beginning for Javelin. It was stressed that Electronic Arts is shaping up to deal with this ‘war on cheating’ in an evolutionary way, and has several steps lined up to combat wrongdoers.

Battlefield 6’s Anti-Cheat is Making Waves

In a post on social media, it was revealed that 2.4 million cheat attempts were actively blocked by EA’s Javelin engine, an anti-cheat solution that keeps Battlefield 6 free from abusive operators. To put some numbers into perspective, it was also noted that, during the open beta alone, a whopping 1.2 million cheat attempts were closed down.

People just won’t give up.

The team wrote:

We are presently aware of, and have multiple detections for, 190 cheat related programs, hardware, vendors, and resellers and their communities. Since launch 183 of them (96.3%) have announced feature failures, detection notices, downtime, and/or taken their cheats offline entirely.

This phenomenal effort by Electronic Arts is set to expand with several key initiatives being lined up:

  • Explore Additional OS Security Features
  • Enforce Against Cheating Hardware
  • Improving Reporting Flows
  • Improving Internal Operations Tools
  • ‘Classified’

That final note is legitimately taken from the document. Some things are being kept under wraps to avoid ‘tipping off’ the cheat manufacturers as to what’s coming next:

We have multiple teams working on various new anti-cheat features and detections across our multi-layered suite of tools across Javelin, the game client, server, and beyond coming online as fast as we can get them ready. As soon as any of these new ways of delivering ban hammers are fully tested and ready we’ll share more but for now we don’t want to tip our hand to any bad-actors looking to ruin your game experience.

Have you been impacted by cheaters in Battlefield 6? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that ARC Raiders invented a whole new genre

item.title: Best PS5 Games to Gift This Holiday 2025
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 Holiday season is sure to be a joyous one, and you can celebrate that by purchasing some new PS5 games for yourself and as presents for others.

It’s been another great year to be a PlayStation 5 owner. With new exclusives and seismic third-party launches, your big, white device is ready to gobble up new discs and live out fresh experiences. Insider Gaming has carefully curated a long list of games you should buy this Holiday 2025 season.

Be sure to check out Insider Gaming’s Holiday 2025 hub for the best deals available across all platforms and occasions.

The Best PS5 Games For Holiday 2025

Astro Bot

2024’s Game of the Year winner is as affordable as ever. It’s a fantastic walk down memory lane for Sony’s exhaustive catalogue of incredible franchises. It’s also the perfect reminder that 3D platformers aren’t dead, and Astro Bot is a premium product from back to front that appeals to all age brackets.

Ghost of Yotei

Sucker Punch’s long-awaited and hotly anticipated sequel to Ghost of Tsushima. Ghost of Yotei is another spellbinding action-adventure game with slick swordplay, more weapons and options than its predecessor, and it’s just as good as the original (maybe better?). It’s the biggest PS5 exclusive of the year by far, and is a proper system-selling game.

Battlefield 6

It feels incredible to have a proper Battlefield game back. Let’s not talk about the last BF game, because Battlefield 6 is fantastic from top to bottom. It features a campaign tailored for single-player enthusiasts, an extensive multiplayer mode packed with maps, mayhem, and a multitude of playlist options. Additionally, there’s Battlefield: RedSec, offering battle royale and extended game modes.

Metal Gear Solid 3 is considered to be the definitive MGA game for many. Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater takes the 2004 original and shows everyone what a modern-day version of it looks like. It will likely scoop up many ‘Best Remaster of 2025’ awards, and it will reward you for investing some money into the epic remake.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

Black Ops 7 will adorn the base of many Christmas trees in Holiday 2025. Treyarch has been given the privilege of delivering back-to-back CoD games, and while Black Ops 7 has had a mixed reception, its online multiplayer is a smooth and swift as any in recent memory. With a campaign, Zombies, and seasonal updates to come, Black Ops 7 is a shred investment and a top gift.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

Turn-based gameplay hit the mainstream once more with Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. Following in the footsteps of old-school Final Fantasy games, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is the first project from a studio very much in its infancy. The result of a GOTY-contending, 30-to-60 hour playthrough you shouldn’t miss at all costs.

The Last Of Us Part II (Remastered)

Last year’s The Last Of Us Part II (Remastered) is the perfect way to capitalize on 2025’s The Last Of Us Season 2 on TV. The second season finally hit screens this year, and it’s based on the events of The Last of Us Part II (Remastered). It’s easily one of the cheapest games on this Holiday 2025 list, and is even cheaper with Insider Gaming’s link.

EA FC 26

If there’s a new Call of Duty, you’d better believe there’s a new EA FC game. The feedback-driven nature of EA FC 26 means it’s trying to appeal to you, the player, more than ever. You can grab EA FC 26 for cheap, take your favorite teams to gold and glory, make your own hilarious Pros, and assemble the Ultimate Team.

Stellar Blade

Stellar Blade is ‘The best-selling PlayStation-exclusive launch IP in history’ for PC. It has a sequel on the way, is going multiplatform, and for a game released in 2024, it still seems to be gaining momentum. You too can join this movement by making Holiday 2025 a stellar one.

The official Insider Gaming Discord server is where you can talk about games, share your own Holiday 2025 bargains, and more.
